result.execSummary:
The defendant Crystal M Lamar was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: Possession of a Controlled Substance on or near Certain Places, Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If probation becomes revoked, the defendant is to receive sentence credit of 53 days.

miscConds.notes: Court orders the cash bond on file be applied first to the restitution on 2015CM125 and then to the court costs on this case.

-Defendant is to complete an alcohol and drug abuse assessment (AODA) and comply with any follow-up counseling as recommended.
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent including any counseling and/or treatment as recommended.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

timeConds.notes: Stayed pending successful completion of ARC.

defendant.name: Lamar, Crystal M
defendant.address: 571 County Road A, C/O Green Lake County Jail, Green Lake, WI 54941

records.addlTxt: of Conviction (DOC-37) - extends probation for one year (03/15/2020)

Per Agent Kari Stockwell - defendant has been an absconder and finally got caught on our warrant on Thursday of last week again in Milwaukee.  I see that her discharge date was 03/15/19 on both of them.  She has made no payments towards either account.  We stopped her time so she will probably have a couple of months for us to still work with.  The plan right now is that she will be released from Milwaukee County jail and ordered to report to the office.

43

9:12 a.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court without counsel.  Agent Kari Stockwell present in court.  Statement by the Court - on 11CF19 defendant is currently on the prison sentence.  The other 3 cases the probation is concurrent to that.  Agent Stockwell concurs.  Defendant concurs.  Statement by the Court  - on 15CM57 & 15CM125 - theses cases have expired and the Court will enter civil judgments on those.  2015CF88 - defendant is still on probation.  Statement by Agent Stockwell.  Court questions defendant.  Court will find probable cause and extends probation for an additional year.  Court informs defendant that is extended again, the court will fashion conditions to include jail time.  Court will review in another year.

Court adjourned at 9:17 a.m.
Probation review hearing on December 10, 2018 at 09:00 am.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Settlement Form (PTC)

9:25 a.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Court recites agreement - defendant will plea to count 1 & 4 in 2015CM125, DRI counts 2 & 3; will plea to count 1 with no repeater on 2015CM57; will plea to count 1 on 2015CF88 and DRI counts 2 & 3; will plea to count 1 on 2016CF17 and DRI count 2.  State concurs.  Atty Privat concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.  (If felony) Court instructs regarding felony prohibitions.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on Count 1 on 2015CF88 and counts 2 & 3 dismissed and read-in; on Count 1 on 2015CM57, striking the repeater; on Counts 1 & 4 as charged on 2015CM125 and orders counts 2 & 3 dismissed and read-in and count 1 as charged on 2016CF17 and count 2 dismissed and read-in.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  ADA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Sentencing statement by ADA.  Sentencing argument by Atty Privat.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

*2015CF88 (Count 1) - SWD, and places the defendant on probation for 3 years.

CONDITIONS:

-60 days county jail, stayed pending successful completion of ARC.
-Court costs.
-Defendant is to complete an alcohol and drug abuse assessment (AODA) and comply with any follow-up counseling as recommended.
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent including any counseling and/or treatment as recommended.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

*2015CM57 (Count 1) - SWD, and places the defendant on probation for 24 months.

CONDITIONS:

-Court costs
-Clinical evaluation and any recommended treatment. 
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent including any counseling and/or treatment as recommended.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

*2015CM125 (Count 1) - SWD, and places the defendant on probation for 24 months.

CONDITIONS:

-Court costs.
-Restitution - $329.12
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent including any counseling and/or treatment as recommended.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.


*2015CM125 (Count 4) - SWD, and places the defendant on probation for 24 months.

CONDITIONS:

-Court costs.
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent including any counseling and/or treatment as recommended.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.


*2016CF17 (Count 1) - SWD, and places the defendant on probation for 12 months.

CONDITIONS:

-Court costs.
-Defendant is to complete an alcohol and drug abuse assessment (AODA) and comply with any follow-up counseling as recommended.
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent including any counseling and/or treatment as recommended.
-List all people the defendant is going to associate with and go thru each one with the agent.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

$500 cash bond on file in 2015CF88 first to the restitution in 2015CM125 then to the court costs.

Defendant is to receive credit of 53 days on 2015CF88 if probation is revoked.
